page.title: 10Stagsden,Services.
page.content: Stagsden has a small post office in a house which supplies stamps, pensions, and 2 mail collections and 1 delivery per day.Milk is delivered by both Unigate and Co-op milkman and daily papers delivered from Bromham.Two free newspapers, mainly suppotred by advertisements, are delivered and there is bi-monthly village newsletter.The mobile library calls fortnightly.A mobile shop visits once a week run by a villager and sells fresh fruit and vegetables and dry goods.The local garage no longer sells petrol but does repairs only. There are bus routes to Bedford, Milton Keynes and Oxford.7 buses a day go into Bedford and 6 return between 8.30 a.m.and 6.0 p.m. which is considered inconveniently early.The nearest doctors are in Kempston or Harrold.
